metadata.title: CVE-2022-0168 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS. (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
A denial of service (DOS) issue was found in the Linux kernelâ€™ssmb2_ioctl_query_info function in the fs/cifs/smb2ops.c Common InternetFile System (CIFS) due to an incorrect return from the memdup_userfunction. This flaw allows a local, privileged (CAP_SYS_ADMIN) attacker tocrash the system.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-0168` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.5.0-9-generic - 6.2.0-20.20
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-generic - 6.2.0-20.20
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-generic-64k - 6.2.0-20.20
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1008-aws - 6.2.0-1003.3
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1007-azure - 6.2.0-1003.3
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1007-gcp - 6.2.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1009-ibm - 6.2.0-1001.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1010-oracle - 6.2.0-1003.3
No subscription required

linux-image-6.5.0-1005-raspi - 6.2.0-1004.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-lowlatency - 6.2.0-1003.3
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-lowlatency-64k - 6.2.0-1003.3
No subscription required
